definition: to watch attentively/to fix one's attention on/to stare at/to gaze at

sentences.english: She hired a detective to shadow her husband.
sentences.chinese: 她僱了私家偵探盯梢她丈夫。

sentences.english: “Enjoy the stalking, ” was his farewell remark.
sentences.chinese: “享受盯梢追捕的樂趣”，他臨別致辭。

sentences.english: The underground worker threw off the spy who had been tailing him.
sentences.chinese: 這個地下工作者把盯梢的特務甩掉了。

sentences.english: S. A… My hawk is a young red tailed hawk.
sentences.chinese: 我的鷹是一隻幼小紅色被盯梢的鷹。

sentences.english: If nothing maple story mesos goes wrong, you will feel angry toward other's stare with you that way.
sentences.chinese: 如果一切正常，你就會對別人的這種盯梢很氣憤。

sentences.english: The police have been shadowing him for months.
sentences.chinese: 警察盯梢他好幾個月了。

sentences.english: Dinosaur Ethan on a lookout for friends.
sentences.chinese: 恐龍伊桑幫他的朋友們盯梢。

sentences.english: Same thing goes for wall-to-wall stalking the love of your 7th grade life.
sentences.chinese: 也不要利用塗鴉牆盯梢你的七年級對象。

definition: to monitor/to keep a close watch over/surveillance
lit. beat the grass to scare the snake (idiom)/fig. to inadvertently alert an enemy/to punish sb as a warning to others
(of a cadre etc) to work for a period of time with a grassroots unit to gain firsthand experience/(dialect) taking a crap
to tail behind/to tag along/to follow on the heels of
to pry into/to spy on/to probe into
to keep watch/to do sentry duty/to be on patrol
to follow sb's tracks/to tail/to shadow/tracking
